sense.name: an intrinsic characteristic of something
sense.examples: High intelligence is an important attribute for pursuing theoretical physics. He described the attributes of the wine as concentrated fruit, balanced finish and notes of blackberry and spice. Mary thinks John's best attribute is his deep voice.

sense.name: a word that is a modifier, e.g. adjective
sense.examples: Attributes in this language agree in case marking with their nouns. This form of the German attribute is masculine dative singular.

sense.name: a symbolic representation in art of a mythical or divine person
sense.examples: The dove in this 15th-century work is an attribute for the Holy Ghost. Various flowers in the painting are attributes for gods in their pantheon.
